definition.name: Preserved_Setwise
definition.definition: A partition P = {B₁, B₂, ..., Bₙ} of Ω is preserved setwise by a permutation σ ∈ Sym(Ω) if for each block Bᵢ ∈ P, the image σ(Bᵢ) is also a block in P. Formally: ∀B ∈ P, ∃B' ∈ P such that σ(B) = B'. This induces a permutation of the blocks themselves. A group G ≤ Sym(Ω) preserves P setwise if every g ∈ G preserves P setwise.
